definitions.definition: The feeling of not being happy
A person who lodges in another's house (compare tenant).
A lottery in which the prize or prizes constitute all the money paid by the participants.
A prize draw.
The part of the Earth's atmosphere beginning at an altitude of about 50 kilometers (31 miles) and extending outward 500 kilometers (310 miles) or more.
The similar region of the atmosphere of another planet.
A short, compact harpsichord or piano.
A spinney.
A minor league baseball, ice hockey or other sports team, especially one concerned with player development.
A rock music genre marked by a heavy regular beat, high amplification, and usually frenzied performances.
A semi-solid to almost solid colloid of a solid and a liquid, such as jelly, cheese or opal.
Any gel intended for a particular cosmetic use, such as for styling the hair.
To apply (cosmetic) gel to (the hair, etc).
To become a gel.
To develop a rapport.
definitions.example: He was a nice guy, and I got on OK with his friends, but the two of us never really gelled.

definitions.definition: A girl.
A person of little worth or usefulness.
Useless; worthless.
Hairstyle
To style or arrange hair
A companion for someone (especially a child) to play with.
A female who has appeared as the centerfold in Playboy magazine.
A person's lover.
A person who studies or practices dietetics.
To distribute among a number of recipients, to give out as one’s portion or share.
definitions.example: The fighting is over; now we deal out the spoils of victory.

definitions.definition: To administer or give out, as in small portions.
To distribute cards to the players in a game.
definitions.example: I was dealt four aces.

definitions.definition: To pitch.
definitions.example: The whole crowd waited for him to deal a real humdinger.

definitions.definition: To have dealings or business.
To conduct oneself, to behave.
To take action; to act.
To trade professionally (followed by in).
definitions.example: She deals in gold.

definitions.definition: To sell, especially to sell illicit drugs.
definitions.example: This club takes a dim view of members who deal drugs.

definitions.definition: To be concerned with.
To handle, to manage, to cope.
definitions.example: I can't deal with this.

definitions.definition: (chiefly in the plural) A business transaction.
One's manner of acting toward others; behaviour; interactions or relations with others.
The political ideology of being a citizen in a state as a republic under which the people hold popular sovereignty.
The branch of medicine that deals with the prevention or correction of disorders of the bones and associated muscles and joints
A dog, rather like a large greyhound, originally bred in Scotland for hunting deer
To recover health and strength gradually after sickness or weakness.
definitions.example: The patient convalesced for six months after his stroke.

definitions.definition: A reservoir or tank for holding water, especially for catching and holding rainwater for later use.
In a flush toilet, the container in which the water used for flushing is held; a toilet tank.
A cisterna.
The vessel surrounding the condenser in a steam engine.
A narrow box filled with earth, placed on a windowsill and used for growing plants.
One of the hollows in the sides of a window frame for the weights which counterbalance a lifting sash.
Relating to calories.
Relating to or producing heat or other energy.
(of food) High in calories and thus likely fattening.
An official document certifying the details of a person's birth. Name, date, and parents' names are always present; details such as parents' occupation and religion may be included.
Intended for use on something close or nearby.

In the International System of Units, the derived unit of electrical potential and electromotive force (voltage); the potential difference across a conductor when a current of one ampere uses one watt of power. Symbol: V
A circular tread; a gait by which a horse going sideways round a centre makes two concentric tracks.
A sudden movement to avoid a thrust.
A person who translates text, film or other material into a different natural language.
(by extension) One that makes a new version of a source material in a different language or format.
A language interpreter.
A computer program that translates something from one language to another using machine translation.
A continuous association of wage-earners for the purpose of maintaining or improving the conditions of their employment; a trade union.
A facetious or insulting remark; a jeer, a taunt.
definitions.example: He flung subtle jibes at her until she couldn’t bear to work with him any longer.

definitions.definition: To reproach with contemptuous words; to deride, to mock, to taunt.
To say in a mocking or taunting manner.
To make a mocking remark or remarks; to jeer.
To accord or agree.
definitions.example: That explanation doesn’t jibe with the facts.

definitions.definition: Alternative spelling of gybe
Alternative spelling of gybe
A restaurant that bakes and sells pizzas.
A set of teeth, the teeth viewed as a unit
An artificial replacement of one or more teeth
(often in the plural) a complete replacement of all teeth in a mouth
To pronounce.
definitions.example: Please say your name slowly and clearly.

definitions.definition: To recite.
definitions.example: Martha, will you say the Pledge of Allegiance?

definitions.definition: To tell, either verbally or in writing.
definitions.example: He said he would be here tomorrow.

definitions.definition: To indicate in a written form.
definitions.example: The sign says it’s 50 kilometres to Paris.

definitions.definition: To have a common expression; used in singular passive voice or plural active voice to indicate a rumor or well-known fact.
definitions.example: They say "when in Rome, do as the Romans do", which means "behave as those around you do."

definitions.definition: Suppose, assume; used to mark an example, supposition or hypothesis.
definitions.example: A holiday somewhere warm – Florida, say – would be nice.

definitions.definition: To speak; to express an opinion; to make answer; to reply.
(of a possession, especially money) To bet as a wager on an outcome; by extension, used to express belief in an outcome by the speaker.
To try; to assay.
A proverb or maxim.
That which is said; a statement.
An often domesticated mammal (Mustela putorius furo) rather like a weasel, descended from the polecat and often trained to hunt burrowing animals.
The black-footed ferret, Mustela nigripes.
A diligent searcher.
To hunt game with ferrets.
(by extension) To uncover and bring to light by searching; usually to ferret out.
A tape of silk, cotton, or ribbon, used to tie documents, clothing, etc. or along the edge of fabric.
A support person, usually female, who may not have medical or midwifery training, who provides emotional and practical assistance to a pregnant mother or couple before, during or after childbirth.
A base, degraded person; a sneak; a gallows bird.
Low; sneaking; ashamed.

Any of the terrestrial isopod crustaceans of suborder Oniscidea, which have a rigid, segmented exoskeleton, often being capable of rolling into a ball, and feed only on dead plant matter, usually living in damp, dark places, such as under stones or bark.
Large in body; fat; overweight.
Physical, material, corporeal.
The south.
Midday, noon.
A great circle passing through the poles of the celestial sphere and the zenith for a particular point on the earth's surface.
An imaginary great circle on the Earth's surface, passing through the geographic poles, or that half of such a circle extending from pole to pole, all points of which have the same longitude.
The highest or most developed point of something; culmination, splendour.
A particular area or situation considered as having a specific identity or characteristic; the tastes or habits of a specific locale, group etc.
The middle period of someone's life, when they are at full strength or abilities; one's prime.
A line passing through the poles of any sphere; a notional line on the surface of a round or curved body.
A dram drunk at midday.
(acupuncture) Any of the pathways on the body along which the vital energy is thought to flow and, therefore, the acupoints are distributed.
The size of type between double great primer and canon, standardized as 44-point.
Meridional; relating to a meridian.
Relating to noon
Relating to the highest point or culmination.
definitions.example: meridian splendour

definitions.definition: A government leftist, especially a communist, socialist, or labour union leader.
Difficult or rebellious.
definitions.example: Kate, don't be so bolshie!

definitions.definition: The agency of a cause; the action or power of a cause, in producing its effect.
The relationship between something that happens or exists and the thing that causes it; the cause and consequence relationship.
Chief officer or leader of a political party or organization, especially in Communist contexts.
A bank of snow accumulated by the wind.
Point of view; perspective
definitions.example: Bathing once a month may save time, but from a cleanliness standpoint, it's not effective.

definitions.definition: Any bird of many-species subfamily Picinae, with a sharp beak suitable for pecking holes in wood.
Type 92 heavy machine gun

(plural mink or minks) Any of various semi-aquatic, carnivorous mammals in the Mustelinae subfamily, similar to weasels, with dark fur, native to Europe and America, of which two species in different genera are extant: the American mink (Neovison vison) and the European mink (Mustela lutreola).
(plural mink) The fur or pelt of a mink, used to make apparel.
(plural minks) An article of clothing made of mink.
(plural minks) An individual with poor personal hygiene; a smelly person.
To enter illegally or by force, especially in order to commit a crime.
definitions.example: Hackers broke into the bank's computer system and stole customer data.

definitions.definition: To open or begin to use.
definitions.example: I finally broke into the second package of cookies.

definitions.definition: To successfully enter a profession or business.
definitions.example: He hopes to break into show business.

definitions.definition: To begin suddenly.
definitions.example: The horse broke into a gallop as they neared the barn.

definitions.definition: A police force.
The police in a particular district or area.
Of, or relating to constables.
Characteristic to police; police-like, rather than military.
definitions.example: Constabulary missions are different from fighting wars.

definitions.definition: A multifunctional room that can be used for any purpose in a palace or castle.
Any room where visitors may be entertained; now, the living room.
A room where engineers draw up plans and patterns.
A levée where ladies are presented at court or to society.
A private room on a railroad sleeping car.
A prisoner sentenced to life in prison.
A prisoner sentenced to transportation for life.
A person with a singular career path, especially in the military.
A bird species seen for the first time by a birder who is keeping a list of all the species he or she has ever seen.
Having no worth or use; without value; inconsequential.
definitions.example: Don't be a worthless slouch! Go get yourself a job.

definitions.definition: An enclosed underground space, often under a building, used for storage or shelter.
A wine collection, especially when stored in a cellar.
Last place in a league or competition.
To store in a cellar.
Salt cellar
A small dish for holding salt.
A broadcast containing weather reports around the coast, especially of the United Kingdom
To subject to a penalty, especially for the infringement of a rule or regulation.
To impose a handicap on.
Anatomical uses.
Figurative uses.
Colloquial uses.
Strike with the beak.
Seize with the beak.
To play truant.
Of or pertaining to someone who exhibits mania or craziness; wicked.
Suffering from mania, the state of an abnormally elevated or irritable mood, arousal, and/or energy levels.
The act of disowning or disinheriting a child.
The act of abdicating; the renunciation of a high office, dignity, or trust, by its holder.
The voluntary renunciation of sovereign power
definitions.example: abdication of the throne, government, power, authority

definitions.definition: The renunciation of interest in a property or a legal claim; abandonment.
The action of being deposed from the seat of power.
International trade without government interference, especially from tariffs or duties on imports.
(heading) To capture, overtake.
(heading) To seize hold of.
(heading) To intercept.
(heading) To receive (by being in the way).
(heading) To take in with one's senses or intellect.
(heading) To seize attention, interest.
(heading) To obtain or experience
The action of the verb catch.
Contagious
Captivating; alluring; catchy
An expert in virtù or art objects and antiquities; a connoisseur.
Someone with special skill or knowledge; an expert.
Specifically, a musician (or other performer) with masterly ability, technique, or personal style.
Exhibiting the ability of a virtuoso.
A basket, pen or enclosure for birds or small animals.
A wickerwork basket (kipe) or other enclosure for catching fish.
A narrow place of confinement, a cage; a jail, a prison.
A barrel or cask for holding liquids.
To keep in a coop.
To shut up or confine in a narrow space; to cramp.
To unlawfully confine one or more voters to prevent them from casting their ballots in an election.
(law enforcement) Of a police officer: to sleep or relax while on duty.
To make or repair barrels, casks and other wooden vessels; to work upon in the manner of a cooper.
A cart with sides and ends made from boards, enabling it to carry manure, etc.
A cart which opens at the back to release its load; a tumbril.
A small heap.
A unit of a housing co-operative; a purchased apartment where the apartment owners collectively are responsible for maintenance of common areas and upkeep.
Any co-operative, including housing, retail, utility, agricultural, banking or worker cooperatives.
Any shop owned by a co-operative.
A co-operative game, as opposed to a competitive game or deathmatch.
An enclosed area used to hold bulls.
definitions.example: Magnus and Big Buck are over in the bullspen, ready for tonight's rodeo.

definitions.definition: An enclosed area for pitchers to warm up in during a game.
definitions.example: After that hit, there is activity in the bullpen.

definitions.definition: The relief pitchers of a team collectively.
definitions.example: Their bullpen is worn out after yesterday's doubleheader where both games went 12 innings.

definitions.definition: A place for someone or something to get ready.
definitions.example: If this team of consultants fails, I have another warming up in the bullpen.

definitions.definition: An open seating arrangement where project teams can communicate openly with minimal effort.
definitions.example: We have our sales team in a bullpen setup to keep their energy flowing.

definitions.definition: A person confined to a location, as by illness or infirmity.
definitions.example: He visited shut-ins as a good deed.

definitions.definition: Confined to a location, as by infirmity or illness.
As permitted by law; not contrary to law.
definitions.example: You can legally park in the lot on weekends without paying the fee, they won't ticket you.

definitions.definition: From a legal perspective.
definitions.example: Legally, I think you are covered, but there are angry guys with baseball bats outside.

definitions.definition: In a manner not conforming to the law.
definitions.example: The deceased was unlawfully killed during a riot.

definitions.definition: The cost of an opportunity forgone (and the loss of the benefits that could be received from that opportunity); the most valuable forgone alternative.
A substance or preparation for rendering cloth, leather, etc., impervious to water.
Cloth made waterproof, or any article made of such cloth, or of other waterproof material, as rubber; especially, an outer garment made of such material.
To make waterproof or water-resistant.
Unaffected by water.
Made of or covered with material that doesn't allow water in.
Incapable of failing; unassailable.

Any of the grasshoppers, often polyphenic and usually swarming, in the family Acrididae that are very destructive to crops and other vegetation, (especially) the migratory locust (Locusta migratoria).
A fruit or pod of the carob tree.
Any of various often leguminous trees and shrubs, especially of the genera Robinia and Gleditsia; the locust tree.
A cicada.
A Mainlander.
To come in a swarm.
An Old World bird, Upupa epops, known for its distinctive plumage, fanlike crest, and slender bill.
A shady sitting place, usually in a park or garden, and usually surrounded by climbing shrubs or vines and other vegetation.
A shady walk.
A pipe, tube or canal which carries gas or liquid from one place to another.
definitions.example: heating and air-conditioning ducts

definitions.definition: An enclosure or channel for electrical cable runs.
Guidance; direction.
To channel something through a duct (or series of ducts).
Of a food or diet, low in carbohydrates.
definitions.example: The doctor's recommended low-carb diet meant that the patient would be longing for his morning bagel.

definitions.definition: A type of hotel or lodging establishment, often located near a major highway, which typically features a series of rooms the entrances of which are immediately adjacent to a parking lot to facilitate convenient access to automobiles parked there.
A low-cost short-stay hotel, often with hourly rates rather than daily rates, and notorious for permitting illicit sexual activities; love hotel.
To stay in a motel or motels.
A permanent mark on the skin, sometimes caused by the healing of a wound.
(by extension) A permanent negative effect on someone's mind, caused by a traumatic experience.
Any permanent mark resulting from damage.
To mark the skin permanently.
To form a scar.
To affect deeply in a traumatic manner.
definitions.example: Seeing his parents die in a car crash scarred him for life.

definitions.definition: A cliff or rock outcrop.
A rock in the sea breaking out from the surface of the water.
A bare rocky place on the side of a hill or mountain.
A marine food fish, the scarus or parrotfish (family Scaridae).
A facility, such as a small airport, designed to let helicopters take off and land.
The part of a seat designed to support the sitter's head.
That which annoys.
An act or instance of annoying.
The psychological state of being annoyed or irritated.
A semi-portable stove.
The element of a stove.
A low-powered heating device for keeping food warm.
In a manner that is not definite.
definitions.example: an indefinitely determined fossil

definitions.definition: For a long time, with no defined end.
Forever.
A person, especially a priest, who practices exorcism.
A script editor
A (usually rigid), flat, rectangular measuring or drawing device with graduations in units of measurement; a straightedge with markings.
A person who rules or governs; someone or something that exercises dominion or controlling power over others.
To beat with a ruler (as a traditional school punishment).
Someone who moves about in roving fashion looking for plunder.
definitions.example: a band of marauders

definitions.definition: By extension anything which marauds.
(chiefly in the plural) A protruding area of fat on the side of the body, above the hips.
The quality of being bright.
The perceived luminance of an object.
Intelligence, cleverness.
